intro: Acinodendron guatemalense, commonly known as the Guatemalan acinodendron, is a tropical shrub native to Central America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae and is characterized by its simple, alternate leaves and showy, five-petaled flowers. The plant produces small, capsule-like fruits that contain numerous seeds. It is often found in humid, lowland areas with well-drained soil. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
